flawed_nl_solution:
The tickets for both of her brothers will cost her $10 * 2 = $<<10*2=20>>20.
To buy tickets for all of them, it will cost Isabelle $20 + $20 = $<<20+20=50>>50.
Between all of them, they have saved a total of $5 + $5 = $<<5+5=10>>10.
Since they have already saved $10, she needs to earn an additional $50 - $10 = $<<40=40>>40 to afford the tickets.
Since she makes $3 per week, it will take her $40 / ($3/week) = <<40/(3)=13>>13 weeks to save enough money for all of the tickets.
#### 13

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 40, not 50. It appears there was a miscalculation with the digits before the final zero.
